title: Meta Fined Over \u20b97,000 Crore by EU for Unfair Practices!
text: [Tech News](https://www.news9live.com/technology/tech-news) Meta Fined Over ₹7,000 Crore by EU for Unfair Practices! Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, has been fined approximately ₹7,000 crore by the European Commission for breaching EU antitrust rules. The penalty stems from Meta's alleged unfair advantage in tying Facebook Marketplace to its dominant social network. Meta plans to appeal the decision Meta,͏͏ the͏͏ parent͏͏ company͏͏ of͏͏ Facebook,͏͏ Instagram,͏͏ and͏͏ WhatsApp,͏͏ has͏͏ been͏͏ hit͏͏ with͏͏ a͏͏ hefty͏͏ fine͏͏ of͏͏ €797.72͏͏ million͏͏ (approximately͏͏ ₹7,059͏͏ crore)͏͏ by͏͏ the͏͏ European͏͏ Commission.͏͏ The͏͏ penalty͏͏ comes͏͏ after͏͏ the͏͏ commission͏͏ found͏͏ Meta͏͏ guilty͏͏ of͏͏ breaching͏͏ EU͏͏ antitrust͏͏ rules͏͏ by͏͏ tying͏͏ its͏͏ online͏͏ classified͏͏ ads͏͏ service,͏͏ Facebook͏͏ Marketplace,͏͏ to͏͏ its͏͏ dominant͏͏ social͏͏ network͏͏ platform,͏͏ Facebook. The͏͏ investigation͏͏ into͏͏ Meta’s͏͏ practices͏͏ began͏͏ in͏͏ June͏͏ 2021.͏͏ Regulators͏͏ examined͏͏ how͏͏ the͏͏ company͏͏ allegedly͏͏ leveraged͏͏ its͏͏ vast͏͏ user͏͏ base͏͏ on͏͏ Facebook͏͏ to͏͏ give͏͏ Facebook͏͏ Marketplace͏͏ an͏͏ unfair͏͏ advantage͏͏ over͏͏ other͏͏ online͏͏ classified͏͏ ads͏͏ providers.͏͏ By͏͏ December͏͏ 2022,͏͏ preliminary͏͏ conclusions͏͏ indicated͏͏ that͏͏ Meta’s͏͏ conduct͏͏ violated͏͏ EU͏͏ competition͏͏ laws. European͏͏ Commission’s͏͏ Statement Margrethe͏͏ Vestager,͏͏ Executive͏͏ Vice͏͏ President͏͏ in͏͏ charge͏͏ of͏͏ competition͏͏ policy,͏͏ [stated](https://ec.europa.eu/commission/presscorner/detail/en/ip_24_5801),͏͏ “Meta͏͏ tied͏͏ its͏͏ online͏͏ classified͏͏ ads͏͏ service͏͏ Facebook͏͏ Marketplace͏͏ to͏͏ its͏͏ personal͏͏ social͏͏ network͏͏ Facebook͏͏ and͏͏ imposed͏͏ unfair͏͏ trading͏͏ conditions͏͏ on͏͏ other͏͏ online͏͏ classified͏͏ ads͏͏ service͏͏ providers.͏͏ It͏͏ did͏͏ so͏͏ to͏͏ benefit͏͏ its͏͏ own͏͏ service͏͏ Facebook͏͏ Marketplace,͏͏ thereby͏͏ giving͏͏ it͏͏ advantages͏͏ that͏͏ other͏͏ online͏͏ classified͏͏ ads͏͏ service͏͏ providers͏͏ could͏͏ not͏͏ match.͏͏ This͏͏ is͏͏ illegal͏͏ under͏͏ EU͏͏ antitrust͏͏ rules.͏͏ Meta͏͏ must͏͏ now͏͏ stop͏͏ this͏͏ behaviour.” Meta’s͏͏ Response͏͏ and͏͏ Plans͏͏ to͏͏ Appeal In͏͏ response͏͏ to͏͏ the͏͏ ruling,͏͏ Meta͏͏ expressed͏͏ its͏͏ intention͏͏ to͏͏ appeal.͏͏ The͏͏ company͏͏ released͏͏ a͏͏ [statement͏͏](https://about.fb.com/news/2024/11/our-response-to-the-european-commissions-decision-on-facebook-marketplace/) saying,͏͏ “This͏͏ decision͏͏ ignores͏͏ the͏͏ realities͏͏ of͏͏ the͏͏ thriving͏͏ European͏͏ market͏͏ for͏͏ online͏͏ classified͏͏ listing͏͏ services͏͏ and͏͏ shields͏͏ large͏͏ incumbent͏͏ companies͏͏ from͏͏ a͏͏ new͏͏ entrant,͏͏ Facebook͏͏ Marketplace,͏͏ that͏͏ meets͏͏ consumer͏͏ demand͏͏ in͏͏ innovative͏͏ and͏͏ convenient͏͏ new͏͏ ways.”͏͏ Meta͏͏ argues͏͏ that͏͏ its͏͏ integration͏͏ of͏͏ services͏͏ benefits͏͏ consumers͏͏ and͏͏ promotes͏͏ innovation. This͏͏ is͏͏ not͏͏ the͏͏ first͏͏ time͏͏ Meta͏͏ has͏͏ faced͏͏ significant͏͏ fines͏͏ from͏͏ European͏͏ regulators: - September͏͏ 2022:͏͏ Fined͏͏ over͏͏ $100͏͏ million͏͏ (around͏͏ ₹840͏͏ crore)͏͏ due͏͏ to͏͏ a͏͏ security͏͏ breach͏͏ exposing͏͏ user͏͏ passwords. - January͏͏ 2023:͏͏ Penalized͏͏ more͏͏ than͏͏ $400͏͏ million͏͏ (approximately͏͏ ₹3,362͏͏ crore)͏͏ for͏͏ various͏͏ violations. - May͏͏ 2023:͏͏ Faced͏͏ a͏͏ record-breaking͏͏ fine͏͏ of͏͏ over͏͏ $1͏͏ billion͏͏ (about͏͏ ₹8,404͏͏ crore)͏͏ related͏͏ to͏͏ GDPR͏͏ violations. Additionally,͏͏ Meta͏͏ is͏͏ dealing͏͏ with͏͏ other͏͏ legal͏͏ challenges͏͏ across͏͏ Europe.͏͏ In͏͏ December͏͏ 2022,͏͏ reports͏͏ surfaced͏͏ about͏͏ a͏͏ $600͏͏ million͏͏ damages͏͏ claim͏͏ in͏͏ Spain͏͏ related͏͏ to͏͏ a͏͏ privacy͏͏ breach͏͏ case. What͏͏ This͏͏ Means͏͏ for͏͏ Consumers͏͏ and͏͏ Competitors For͏͏ consumers,͏͏ the͏͏ ruling͏͏ may͏͏ lead͏͏ to͏͏ more͏͏ choices͏͏ in͏͏ the͏͏ online͏͏ classified͏͏ ads͏͏ market͏͏ as͏͏ competition͏͏ is͏͏ encouraged.͏͏ Competitors͏͏ who͏͏ felt͏͏ sidelined͏͏ by͏͏ Meta’s͏͏ practices͏͏ might͏͏ now͏͏ find͏͏ a͏͏ more͏͏ level͏͏ playing͏͏ field.͏͏ However,͏͏ if͏͏ Meta’s͏͏ appeal͏͏ is͏͏ successful,͏͏ the͏͏ landscape͏͏ could͏͏ shift͏͏ once͏͏ again.
